intro: Hedeoma microphylla, commonly known as narrow-leaf hedeoma, is a small, herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are small, narrow, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls and range in color from white to pale purple. Hedeoma microphylla plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for native insects and birds.
